meanings.definition: A person who accompanies and looks after another person or group, especially a young woman.
meanings.sent1: The chaperones ensured the safety of the students during the field trip.
meanings.sent2: The school dance required several chaperones to monitor the students.
meanings.sent3: The chaperones at the party were like guardian angels for the teenagers.
meanings.sent4: The chaperones were the protective shields for the young travelers.
meanings.sent5: The chaperones were like caring guides, watching over the group with kindness.

meanings.definition: To accompany and supervise a group of people, especially young people, as a chaperone.
meanings.sent1: She chaperones the students on their way to the museum.
meanings.sent2: The teacher chaperones the class during the school trip.
meanings.sent3: He chaperones the children with a watchful eye and a friendly smile.
meanings.sent4: The camp counselor chaperones the campers on the nature hike.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide chaperones the tourists around the historic city.
